sen.j: 正親町三条 実興（おおぎまちさんじょう さねおき、長禄元年（1457年）‐文明 (日本)13年1月3日 (旧暦)（1481年2月1日））は、室町時代の公卿。
sen.e: Saneoki OGIMACHISANJO (1457 - February 1, 1481) was a Kugyo (a top court official) in the Muromachi period.
Saneoki OGIMACHISANJO (1457 - February 1, 1481) was a Kugyo (top court official) during the Muromachi period.
Saneoki OGIMACHISANJO (1457 - February 10, 1481) was a Kugyo (top court official) during the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直しました。

sen.j: 後花園天皇（102代）・後土御門天皇（103代）の二帝にわたり仕えた廷臣で官位は正四位上参議まで昇った。
sen.e: He was a retainer of Imperial Court who served two generations: Emperor GoHanazono (102nd) and Emperor Gotsuchimikado (103th), and his highest official court rank was Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank Upper Grade) Sangi (councillor).

He was a retainer of the Imperial Court serving two generations: Emperor GoHanazono (102nd) and Emperor Gotsuchimikado (103th), and his highest official court rank was Shoshiinojo (Senior 4th Rank Upper Grade) Sangi (councillor).

He was a retainer of the Imperial Court serving two generations: Emperor Gohanazono (102nd) and Emperor Gotsuchimikado (103rd), and his highest official court rank was Shoshiinojo (Senior Forth Rank, Upper Grade) Sangi (councilor).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 父は大納言正親町三条公治。
sen.e: His father was Dainagon (major counsellor) Kinharu OGIMACHISANJO.
His father was Dainagon (major counsellor) Kinharu OGIMACHISANJO.
His father was Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Kinharu OGIMACHISANJO.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 弟に内大臣正親町三条実望がいる。
sen.e: His younger brother was Naidaijin (Inner Minister) Sanemochi OGIMACHISANJO.
His younger brother was Naidaijin (Inner Minister) Sanemochi OGIMACHISANJO.
His younger brother was Naidaijin (Minister of the Interior) Sanemochi OGIMACHISANJO.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 長禄2年（1458年）叙爵し、以降累進して侍従・右近衛権少将・下野権介・右近衛中将・蔵人頭をへて、文明12年（1480年）に参議となり、公卿に列したが、その翌年に薨去。
sen.e: He was ennobled in 1458, and then he was successively promoted to jiju (a chamberlain), Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Shimotsuke Province, Konoefu, and Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), and finally became Sangi (councillor) in 1480 to rank with Kugyo, but deceased in the next year.

He was ennobled in 1458, and then he was successively promoted to jiju (chamberlain), Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Shimotsuke Province, Konoefu, and Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), and finally became Sangi (councillor) in 1480 to rank with Kugyo, but died during the following year.

He was ennobled in 1458, and then he was successively promoted to jiju (chamberlain), Ukone no Gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Shimotsuke no Gon no suke (Provisional Assistant Governor of Shimotsuke Province), Ukone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain), and finally became Sangi in 1480 to rank with Kugyo, but died in the following year.
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたため、原文・訳文を修正しました。

sen.e: His age at death was twenty-five.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
